answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Enlarged testicle, with jelly like feeling around it is usually due to hydrocele. It is a painless and harmless swelling, treatment is not required unless it is causing discomfort due it’s size, infection and bleeding.Coming to curved penis, occurring suddenly could be due to recurrent UTI’s or peyronnie’s disease. Also inability to maintain erection could be a manifestation of this problem. But at your age and if you are having any other medical conditions like hypertension and diabetes, there could be some degree of erectile dysfunction.Intermittent stream can occur due to enlarged prostrate, stricture urethra, stones in the urinary tract etc. A DRE of the prostrate and cystoscopy would aid in making diagnosis.Consult a urologist and discuss the above mentioned possibilities.Best.

question: I have all of the above symptoms.  The testicle is not only enlarged but seems to have a 'jelly like' substance around it.The curved penis suddenly happened upon waking about 6-9 months ago, never having been curved before.  Also, any erection that occurs, seems to be somewhat flacid and disfunctional.  And recently, I have been having stream problems.  My family doctor saw me about 6 months ago, and did order a PSA test which was normal.I'm 5'10", 250lbs (much overweight, I know), but am disabled with lumbar spinal problems.  I am 63 years of age.
title: enlarged testicle+curved penis+intermitten stream
